tweets.text: One year on from #StormCiara, a £10m package of work to repair flood embankments on the lower River Aire is making good progress. 18 defences have been repaired so far, to protect local communities from the risk of #flooding. https://t.co/C8Fy7i7K90 https://t.co/PllNyJlKU6

From Monday 1st of March the EA will start building their compound in Rowntree Park. This is on the Butcher Terrace football field. The closure of Terry Avenue (except access) is a few weeks later. See Clementhorpe Flood Defences for details. @EnvAgencyYNE @CityofYork

tweets.text:
Just received this from @EnvAgency

"...current levels of abstraction are causing environmental damage. Any increase in use WITHIN EXISTING LICENSED VOLUMES will increase the pressure on a system that is already failing environmental targets." 

Thread 1/2 https://t.co/1mnOuVTXt7

@suesustainable @DrmSqnc @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Diffuse pollution from farming is a significant problem - runoff from land spreading, soil erosion, excessive fertilisation, pesticide application etc as well as point source from silage clamps, slurry stores etc. I've not seen evidence it's worse than it was historically though?

Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa
@DrmSqnc @Feargal_Sharkey @suesustainable @EnvAgency And now just as environmental issues are the height of discussion it seems they give up monitoring?

This week we’ve completed a leakage test on a flood gate at #Gowdall near #Snaith, to test repairs we’ve made to the seals. This is part of our repair programme of work to flood defences on the lower River Aire following #StormCiara https://t.co/usprzI5xDy
Appears I might not be the only one that thinks there needs to be wholesale change at the @EnvAgency. https://t.co/HxjsbyCtIP

The weir at Hillsborough Corner was badly damaged in the flooding last November, I wonder why it hasn’t been fixed as it’ll only get worse 😬 Does anyone know who’s responsible? #Sheffield #SheffieldIsSuper https://t.co/FhZ68ErNNz
Here’s my short video of the damage to Hillsborough Corner weir 😧 I’m stunned #sheffieldfloods #2019 https://t.co/cFbupC50ye
@steelcitysnaps @ianbozwell @EnvAgency aware? Are there plans to repair the flood damage shown?

Our water supplies are under pressure from climate change, population growth and drought.

We've launched a consultation on our updated map of the areas where this pressure could be greatest.

Help us safeguard future water supplies. Share your views here: https://t.co/WBWHPEVE9u https://t.co/smkQXkHtCJ

tweets.text: @robleedavies @EnvAgencyMids Is it a pressure logger that you use of has the tech moved on again? Some of the Irish rivers are still monitored by paper on a drum and pen.

@scottdegg @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency @NewsNBC @BBCBreaking @BBCRadioStoke @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @NUL_Labour @PHE_uk @BBCWatchdog Its not. Maybe time for a bit of direct action and take the protest show on the road to the directors own homes.

Everything pieceful. But actually prove to them that they can't dump this problem on someone else's doorstep then run away from it.

tweets.text: @scottdegg @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency @NewsNBC @BBCBreaking @BBCRadioStoke @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @NUL_Labour @PHE_uk @BBCWatchdog I live 1.7 miles away in Newcastle centre near Morrison’s. First time tonight that the smell woke me up as I slept with no windows open at 4 am. Smelt it many nights last year when a window was opened but this time it must be a  lot stronger! Have reported to EA
Installing a new #river monitoring station near #Leintwardine. This new site is 100% powered by #solar power and the data will help us better understand the river #Teme. https://t.co/HWZpYKJOaG

Breaking: @thameswater fined £2.3m, with costs of nearly £90,000 for “entirely foreseeable” #pollution.

More than 1,100 fish died when equipment failures released sewage into 2 streams at Henley in 2016.
Please report suspected pollution in rivers and streams to us: 0800 807060 https://t.co/cIwVfJmJ8q

Air Quality monitoring equipment has now been installed near to the Walleys quarry landfill by @EnvAgencyMids I hope it is picking up the awful odours experienced again today / this evening and that they finally accept the source and take action against the perpetrators. 😷 https://t.co/lP9qd1flaF

The damaged weir on the River Loxley at Hillsborough Corner is even worse now after the recent high-water levels, it needs to be repaired while there’s still some of the weir left 😬🙈 #Sheffield #SheffieldIsSuper https://t.co/xHHphIi0BJ
The @EnvAgency reveals there's ‘pattern’ of #EfW plant’s needing to increase capacity due to #COVID19 #coronavirus  https://t.co/qdwgnUSJ9l

urls.title: Environment Agency reveals ‘pattern’ of EfW plant’s increasing capacity

The @guardian’s take on our prosecution of @thameswater today... ⬇️

... for polluting an #Oxfordshire stream... More than 1,100 fish died...

... including roach, perch and pike...

More evidence we ARE a tough regulator... 
#legalnews #environment https://t.co/HR5hXP1evW

entity.name: Good Morning Britain
entity.description: Good morning, Britain. Up early and need to catch up on the latest news, weather and sports? Then this weekday morning programme is for you, offering the latest information in such areas as entertainment, health and money. `Good Morning Britain' is the typical morning news and talk show. It features a number of presenters, correspondents and reporters covering what you should know to start your day before heading out the door.

tweets.text: Great aerial footage of our team working with @EnvAgencyNW flying one-tonne bags across the reserve at Lunt Meadows, to fix the breach in the River Alt, after recent flooding. The work will make it safe again for wildlife and visitors. https://t.co/WFk4Oi21ba

@Feargal_Sharkey @suesustainable @EnvAgency It's bizarre. This is from 2018. From A Green Future: Our 25 Year Plan to Improve the Enviroment. Are our rivers really cleaner than 50 years ago? https://t.co/X5mJGwfubn

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency WHAT? So if the EA aren’t looking at environmental pollution, what is the point of them then? What are their targets? Looking good on social media? Their Twitter says “it’s our job to look after your environment”. 😳

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Then what is the point of calling it the ENVIRONMENTAL agency? What is the point of the agency at all? This is disgraceful. Rivers should not be used as open sewers. Utterly disgusting. I’m appalled. 🤬🤬🤬🤬🤮🤮🤮🤮🤮

Makes no sense that to 'protect' Coggeshall from flooding, @EnvAgency thinks a £25m project (dam & quarry) on the Blackwater will help - look at the map - flooding from Robins Brook & surface water is a high proportion of the risk  @piersmeyler @BW_Times @SarahPhillips8 https://t.co/uNeNgbpqj9

"Damaging floods are more and more frequent and with #climatechange extreme flooding events are not going away
"With public finances stretched to the limit @defra & @EnvAgency have to do more to make sure limited funds for #flood defence & #risk management are spent effectively"

tweets.text: More hard work from @EnvAgency to repair the embankment at #LuntMeadows 🎉 Please don't visit the reserve while works are taking place as heavy plant machinery will be operating for the next few weeks. You can find out more here: https://t.co/R1NULAET8m https://t.co/gZigRCAGbU

#Didyouknow as part of the #A120 #LittleHadhamBypass scheme we are working in partnership with the @EnvAgency to provide protection to #LittleHadham residents and downstream communities from being flooded by the River Ash, Albury Tributary and Lloyd Taylor Drain https://t.co/UEsxLDPwFS

Natural flood management #nfm in #Marchington woodlands. Leaky dams and flow deflectors slowing and holding surface water flow. Felled trees also helping more light into #woodland for wider ecological benefits. @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/gtVR1Y7ihs

We’re proud to be part of this massive collaboration for the North...flood, water quality, habitat, carbon, landscape, green jobs....it does it all #greatnorthbog @EnvAgencyYNE @yorkshire_dales @YWT_North @NE_Northumbria @NatureNorth3 @PeakChief @moorsforfuture @NorthPennChief https://t.co/sfi8vtKn2n
